column1: Issue: Product update operations and details are logged and exposed
column4: and prices. This exposure is found in the logs on line numbers 1 and 2.

column1: Solution: Limit the information logged during operations. Sensitive product data should not be part of standard logging. Ensure that only necessary and non-sensitive information are included in logs.
Vulnerability: CWE-532: Information Exposure Through Log Files
Issue: Log files might be accessed by unauthorized individuals leading to sensitive information exposure as captured in the logs on line numbers 1 and 2.
Solution: Implement strict access controls to protect log files from unauthorized access. Consider encrypting logs containing sensitive information.

column2: there is no exposure of personal identifiable information (PII) and payment card information (PCI) in the logs. However
column3: if the system starts logging such information in future

column1: Solution: Explicitly program the system to exclude any PII and PCI data from logging. Regularly audit logs and data handling processes to ensure GDPR compliance.
